etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in Anna Seward (1742–1809), poet and correspondent. Alteration (with suffix substitution) of impersonate, probably after impersonization

definitions: To represent or imagine (an immaterial thing or abstract quality) as a person or being; to personify; (also) to be the embodiment or epitome of something.

notes.text: Frequently in passive, especially in later use.
